intro: Papaver rhoeas var. vulgare, commonly known as the common poppy, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Western Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its vibrant red petals and a distinctive black, spherical seed pod. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in the summer months, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. The common poppy is also known for its historical use in the production of opium.
